event: Birth of Aristotle, Greek philosopher and student of Plato.
Assassination of Julius Caesar on the Ides of March.
Fall of the Western Roman Empire—Romulus Augustulus deposed.
Vikings raid the Lindisfarne monastery, beginning the Viking Age in Europe.
Battle of Hastings: William the Conqueror defeats Harold II to become King of England.
Magna Carta sealed by King John of England at Runnymede.
Christopher Columbus lands in the Americas (Bahamas), beginning widespread European exploration.
Martin Luther posts his 95 Theses in Wittenberg—start of the Protestant Reformation.
Jamestown, Virginia, established as first permanent English settlement in the Americas.
Newton publishes 'Principia Mathematica', laying foundation of classical mechanics.
American Declaration of Independence adopted.
Storming of the Bastille—Parisians revolt, symbol of the French Revolution.
Napoleon crowns himself Emperor of the French at Notre-Dame Cathedral, Paris.
Battle of Waterloo—Napoleon defeated by allied British and Prussian forces.
First public railway opens (Stockton and Darlington Railway), ushering in railway age.
Began Revolutions of 1848 across Europe—a wave of liberal and nationalist uprisings.
American Civil War begins with Confederate attack on Fort Sumter.
US President Abraham Lincoln dies after being shot at Ford's Theatre.
Thomas Edison demonstrates the incandescent light bulb.
Statue of Liberty arrives in New York Harbor from France.
Start of World War I—Austria-Hungary declares war on Serbia.
Bolshevik Revolution in Russia—Lenin seizes power in October Revolution.
Armistice signed—World War I ends on the eleventh hour.
Black Tuesday—Wall Street crash precipitates the Great Depression.
Start of World War II—Germany invades Poland.
Pearl Harbor attacked; US enters World War II.
VE Day—Victory in Europe at the end of WWII.
India gains independence from British rule.
People's Republic of China proclaimed by Mao Zedong.
Sir Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay reach the summit of Mount Everest.
Rosa Parks refuses to give up her seat, sparking Montgomery Bus Boycott.
Launch of Sputnik 1—the first artificial satellite.
Yuri Gagarin becomes the first person in space.
U.S. President John F. Kennedy assassinated in Dallas, Texas.
Apollo 11 Moon landing—Neil Armstrong walks on the lunar surface.
Bangladesh Liberation War concludes with the surrender of Pakistani forces.
First Space Shuttle (Columbia) launched by NASA.
Chernobyl nuclear disaster occurs in Ukraine.
Fall of the Berlin Wall—East Germans cross freely into West Berlin.
Dissolution of the Soviet Union—Gorbachev resigns.
First non-racial democratic elections in South Africa—Nelson Mandela becomes president.
Hong Kong handed over from UK to China.
Al-Qaeda attacks on World Trade Center and Pentagon.
Indian Ocean tsunami—devastating coastal communities after massive quake.
Barack Obama elected as the 44th President of the United States.
Osama bin Laden killed by U.S. Navy SEALs in Pakistan.
NASA's Curiosity rover lands on Mars.
Brexit referendum—UK votes to leave the European Union.
Women’s March draws millions worldwide the day after U.S. presidential inauguration.
WHO declares COVID-19 a global pandemic.
Chandrayaan-3 lands near the Moon’s south pole—India’s historic lunar success.
Total solar eclipse visible across North America.
Centennial celebration of India’s independence.
